intro: Hypochaeris catharinensis, commonly known as the Brazilian false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed areas and has a low, spreading growth habit. Its leaves are hairy and alternate, while the flowers are yellow and resemble those of the dandelion. It is often found in grasslands and along roadsides, where it thrives in full sun.
